archetype.archetype_expression: The experienced parent friend who genuinely helps without judgment. Has been there, done that, knows what actually works. Shares wisdom without preaching, supports without enabling, guides without controlling. The friend whose house you go to when you need real advice over coffee.

soul.one_sentence: The supportive friend every parent deserves—real advice, no judgment, genuine help.
soul.expanded: Parenting is hard. Family life is messy. We don't pretend otherwise. We're here with practical solutions that work in real life, not Pinterest perfection. Every family is different, and we respect that while offering research-backed, genuinely helpful guidance that acknowledges the chaos while helping you thrive within it.
soul.what_we_are: A judgment-free zone for parents seeking real help. Practical, evidence-based advice. A community that celebrates 'good enough' parenting. Support for all family structures.
soul.what_we_are_not: Not mommy-blogger perfection. Not shame-inducing impossible standards. Not one-size-fits-all prescriptions. Not sponsored content disguised as advice.

if_this_site_were.person: A 38-year-old parent of three who has seen it all—tantrums in Target, teenage drama, the works. Warm, slightly frazzled, but genuinely wise. Laughs about the chaos while actually having figured some things out. Would never judge your screen time choices. Brings wine to playdates and real solutions to problems.
if_this_site_were.place: A warm, lived-in kitchen with evidence of real family life—kids' artwork on the fridge, a few dishes in the sink, comfortable chairs, good coffee. Clean enough to be healthy, messy enough to be happy. The kind of home where you immediately relax.
if_this_site_were.time_of_day: Mid-morning after the school rush, when there's finally time for that coffee and real conversation. Or late evening, kids in bed, finally a moment to breathe and think.
if_this_site_were.season: Early summer—hopeful, full of possibility, active but not overwhelming.
if_this_site_were.sound: Background family noise—distant kids playing, comfortable household sounds. A friend's understanding 'mmhmm' as you share your struggles.
if_this_site_were.texture: Worn soft cotton. Well-loved furniture. A warm mug in your hands. The specific weight of a child falling asleep on your shoulder.
if_this_site_were.smell: Coffee. Clean laundry. Something baking. A hint of kid chaos (playdough, maybe).
if_this_site_were.taste: Good coffee. Comfort food. The taste of something warm and nourishing.
if_this_site_were.temperature: Warm and comfortable. Cozy without being stifling.
if_this_site_were.weather: Sunny with clouds—mostly good, real life, some storms come through.
if_this_site_were.music_genre: Acoustic/indie folk—warm, real, not over-produced. The kind of music that plays in the background of real homes.
if_this_site_were.movie: This Is Us meets Parenthood—the real, messy, beautiful struggle of family.
if_this_site_were.book: A parenting book you actually finish because it's helpful, not preachy. Dog-eared pages where you found real answers.

primary_persona.name: Overwhelmed Olivia
primary_persona.description: A parent (any gender) in the thick of it. Kids between 0-12, juggling work and family, desperately searching for solutions that actually work. Tired of perfect Pinterest parents and mommy shamers. Just wants help that respects their reality.
primary_persona.mindset: Exhausted but trying. Wants to do right by their kids. Skeptical of 'expert' advice but open to genuine help. Values authenticity over perfection.
goals: Find solutions that work in real life
Raise happy, healthy kids without losing self
pain_points: Nothing works like the books say
objections: Is this going to make me feel worse about myself?
Does this person actually have kids?
Is this just ads disguised as content?
trigger_phrases: how to get kids to listen

secondary_persona.name: Preparing Pete
secondary_persona.description: Expecting or new parent preparing for what's ahead. Wants to be ready without the fear-mongering. Looking for realistic expectations.
secondary_persona.how_they_differ: Needs foundational content, what to expect, preparation without panic

tertiary_persona.name: Grandparent Grace
tertiary_persona.description: Grandparent wanting to stay connected with modern parenting approaches. Wants to support without overstepping.
tertiary_persona.how_they_differ: Needs bridge between generations, updated info, boundary navigation

anti_persona.description: Someone looking to judge other parents. Someone wanting 'proof' their parenting style is superior. Those seeking perfect Pinterest aesthetics over real help.
anti_persona.why_not: We don't enable judgment. We're not about perfection. We're here to help, not compete.

visual_philosophy.overall_aesthetic: Warm, lived-in, approachable—like a supportive friend's home

density.description: Comfortable and breathable. Easy to scan when you only have 30 seconds.
density.section_breathing: Generous gaps. Content should feel restful, not overwhelming.
density.never: Never cramped. Never overwhelming. Never adding to the chaos.

contrast.description: Soft contrast. Warm and easy on tired eyes.
contrast.approach: Readable without harsh contrast. Comfortable for reading at 2am.
contrast.never: Never harsh. Never startling. Never demanding attention aggressively.

motion.description: Gentle, smooth, calming. Nothing that adds stress.
motion.speed: Slow to medium—0.4s-0.6s transitions. Calming pace.
motion.style: Soft fades, gentle reveals. Like a slow exhale.
motion.purpose: To create restful experience, not excitement
motion.never: Never bouncy. Never playful-chaotic. Never overwhelming.

texture.never: Never harsh. Never clinical. Never cold.

shape_language.primary_shapes: Soft, rounded, comforting. Like well-worn furniture.
shape_language.border_radius_philosophy: 8-16px—soft and comforting, not sharp or aggressive.
shape_language.never: Never sharp corners. Never aggressive shapes. Never stark geometry.

depth.shadow_style: Very soft, barely there. Cozy, not elevated.
depth.never: Never material design elevation. Never floating cards.

required_flow: Content by age/stage—find what you need

hero_requirements.content_placement: Empathetic headline, quick access to help, search
hero_requirements.cta_style: Supportive: 'Find Help Now', 'What's Your Challenge?', 'Browse by Age'

category_pages.layout_type: Clear organization by topic/age with featured help

single_posts.layout_type: Single column, comfortable, easy to read

grid_philosophy.grid_breaking: Featured help content can span wider

spacing_rhythm.breathing_rule: When tired parents visit, space should feel restful

responsive_philosophy.mobile_approach: Critical—most parents browse on phones while kids nap

navigation.philosophy: Helpful organization—find what you need, fast

headings.personality: Warm, friendly, approachable. Like a friend talking to you.

body.personality: Clear, readable, comfortable. Easy on tired eyes.

accent.usage: Personal touches, 'from one parent to another' notes

photography_style.mood: Real family moments, imperfect and beautiful

illustration_style.style_reference: Children's book illustration quality, but for adults

must_include.description: Clear tag showing what ages content applies to
Personal, warm touches acknowledging shared experience
TL;DR for exhausted parents who need the answer fast

usage_rules.restraint_philosophy: Help, don't add to the chaos

custom_ui_elements.dividers: Soft lines or warm illustrated elements

writing_style.sentence_length: Short to medium. Tired parents need scannable content.
writing_style.vocabulary_level: Everyday language. No parenting jargon without explanation.

voice.perspective: First person (we/I've been there) and second person (you) for connection
forbidden_phrases: If you really loved your kids
Your child will be damaged if

forbidden_ctas: If You Care About Your Kids

what_acceptable_looks_like: But generic—could be any parenting site
what_perfect_looks_like: Exhausted parent lands and immediately exhales
Returns and recommends to other parents

tests.screenshot_test: Would a stressed parent feel relief or more stress seeing this?
tests.swap_test: Could this be mistaken for Pinterest-perfect mommy blog? (Must fail)
tests.memory_test: Did the content actually help with a real problem?
tests.ten_second_test: Can a tired parent find what they need in 10 seconds?

competitive_positioning.how_we_differ: More real, less perfect. Friend advice, not magazine advice.
competitive_positioning.what_they_do_wrong: Too perfect, too much sponsored content, not enough real help
competitive_positioning.what_we_do_better: Authentic voice, practical help, judgment-free support

seo.internal_linking_strategy: Age-appropriate content linked together. Strategies link to specific examples. Always suggest 'next steps'.
